commit_message:
Remove rhel6 and py26 support

el6 is shipped with Python 2.6.x which is not expected
to be supported with the openstack kilo release.

For el6 support we need to do lot of thing differently,
which makes the code more complicated.

This change removes el6 and py26 support from devstack.

This change also removed a discontinued (1 year ago)
openSUSE 12.2 code path, which used a similar codepath as el6.

Several comment related to el6 also removed or modified.

Change-Id: Iea0b0c98a5e11fd85bb5e93c099f740fe05d2f3a

commit_message:
Changed it so you have to explicitly choose the detailed process metrics.

Fixed process setup for kafka and zookeeper.
Also fixed dimensions for the pid_count and made it so pid_count can go
higher than 1 for non-exact matches.

Change-Id: Ia8f44ddf668b976480afcf203eb11fa696f71b5e

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-21 15:31:33.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/checks/python23.py'], 'message': "Fix H238 to allow parent classes to be returned by a function

There was a corner case that wasn't caught before where
you would want to declare a class like this:

    class Foo(six.with_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta, object)):

but this falsely triggered H238. This allows for that and
adds one more docstring update for a failure case.

Change-Id: Ie7cea4156f0da5bf72d16e5eb5f4e13b7c095d3f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix H238 to allow parent classes to be returned by a function

There was a corner case that wasn't caught before where
you would want to declare a class like this:

    class Foo(six.with_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta, object)):

but this falsely triggered H238. This allows for that and
adds one more docstring update for a failure case.

Change-Id: Ie7cea4156f0da5bf72d16e5eb5f4e13b7c095d3f

commit_message:
Make unit tests call the new resource manager

This is the part of the more comprehensive split of
assignments, which rationalizes both the backend and controllers.
In order to make this change easier for reviewers, it is divided
into a number of smaller patches.

Previous patches have:

- Moved role management into its own manager and drivers
- Fixed incorrect doc strings for grant driver methods
- Updated controllers to call the new role manager
- Updated unit tests to call the new role manager
- Refactored the assignment manager and drivers enabling
  projects/domains to be split out
- Fixed incorrect comment about circular dependency between
  assignment and identity
- Moved the logically separated project and domain
  functionality into their own manager/backend (called resource).
- Removes unused pointer to assignment from identity driver
- Uddated controllers and managers to call the new resource
  manager

This patch updates all the unit tests to call the new resource
manager to access projects and domains.

Future patches will:
- Split the assignment controller, giving projects/domains
  their own controller

Partially implements: bp pluggable-assignments
Change-Id: I503fbcfa9fb141a3769aa831b8c6a429ba37c498

commit_message:
Remove unused pointer to assignment in identity driver

The code in identity core that configures the driver stores a
reference to the assignment_api in it. This is never used, so
should be removed.

Closes-bug: 1407540

commit_message:
Move projects and domains to their own backend

This is the part of the more comprehensive split of
assignments, which rationalizes both the backend and controllers.
In order to make this change easier for reviewers, it is divided
into a number of smaller patches.

Previous patches:

- Move role management into its own manager and drivers
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144239/)
- Fix incorrect doc strings for grant driver methods
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144403/)
- Make controllers call the new, split out, role manager
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144494/)
- Make unit tests call the new, split out, role manager
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144548/)
- Refactor the assignment manager and drivers, enabling
  projects/domains to be split out
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144650/)
- Fix incorrect comment about circular dependency between
  assignment and identity
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144850/)

This patch moves the now logically separated project and domain
functionality into their own manager/backend (called resource).

Future patches will:

- Remove unused pointer to assignment in identity driver
- Update the controllers to call the new resource manager
- Update the tests to call the new resource manager
- Split the assignment controller, giving projects/domains
  their own controller

Partially implements: bp pluggable-assignments

Change-Id: I0ff1c2fa30237734d0a25d03dad5be03eb166367

subject: Do not pass PXE net config from bootloader to ramdisk
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 10375, 'name': 'Om Kumar', 'email': 'om.kumar@hpe.com', 'username': 'lazy_prince'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13762, 'name': 'jiangfei', 'email': 'jiangfei0622@huawei.com', 'username': 'jiangfei'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-01-27 20:53:19.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/elilo_efi_pxe_config.template', 'ironic/tests/test_pxe_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/pxe_config.template', 'ironic/drivers/modules/pxe_config.template', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ipxe_config.template'], 'message': "Do not pass PXE net config from bootloader to ramdisk

All PXE templates currently pass network configuration from the
bootloader to the ramdisk via a kernel parameter,
ip=$ip:$tftp-server:$gateway:$netmask. The current deploy-ironic
ramdisks built by DIB uses this to bring up networking manually,
but this behavior exists there for non-PXE deployments where DHCP
is unavailable.  We ideally want ramdisks to use DHCP to allow pushing
more than just ip/gw/nm. This updates PXE templates to not pass net config,
since DHCP is assumed to be functioning for all PXE env.  Without the
ip= parameter, the ramdisk has no easy way to resolve the boot server's
address.  To signal where to callback to, a boot_server parameter has
been added that points back to the TFTP server address.

Closes-bug: 1401298

Change-Id: Icc04de7b8b7324ce685f930d2e8074b0c764fc0c
"}]
commit_message:
Do not pass PXE net config from bootloader to ramdisk

All PXE templates currently pass network configuration from the
bootloader to the ramdisk via a kernel parameter,
ip=$ip:$tftp-server:$gateway:$netmask. The current deploy-ironic
ramdisks built by DIB uses this to bring up networking manually,
but this behavior exists there for non-PXE deployments where DHCP
is unavailable.  We ideally want ramdisks to use DHCP to allow pushing
more than just ip/gw/nm. This updates PXE templates to not pass net config,
since DHCP is assumed to be functioning for all PXE env.  Without the
ip= parameter, the ramdisk has no easy way to resolve the boot server's
address.  To signal where to callback to, a boot_server parameter has
been added that points back to the TFTP server address.

Closes-bug: 1401298

Change-Id: Icc04de7b8b7324ce685f930d2e8074b0c764fc0c

commit_message:
Changed hardcoded Mongodb username to variable

The operating system user used by MongoDB for its files
and processes was hardcoded to "mongodb" for Debian. Other
linux variants use different users. This adds a variable,
MONGO_USER which is set depending on the guest O/S.

Change-Id: I5b47243ff13607766adfc3337d4e31d4c0598c2a
Closes-bug: 1416155

commit_message:
Fix bug wth missing username on database_user resource

I missed a commit with last change to this part.  The
change was to make the resource unique, but the username attribute
was not added to the resource so it will fail.

* Pre-download neutron-lbaas-agent to base disk

commit_message:
Add LBaaS in the lab scripts

This patch adds support to enable neutron LBaaS support in the
training guide's OpenStack installation.

Changes made are as follows

* Pre-download neutron-lbaas-agent to base disk
* Enable LBaaS support on horizon on controller node
* Configure neutron server to support LBaaS with haproxy as provider
  on controller node
* Enable and configure LBaaS agent on network node

Change-Id: I35f8c19ebceb7420f735354337bf71b4d92edf93
Closes-Bug: 1414767

commit_message:
Suspend Py3K jobs for oslo.messaging oslo.rootwrap

Temporarily remove the python3-jobs template from oslo.messaging and
oslo.rootwrap, to be reinstated once the Python 3.4 on Ubuntu Trusty
is fixed to permit running these tests there or once we have another
suitable platform available for them.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-January/055270.html

Change-Id: I434cd5115b74c296d184ac716be55496c5c7307a
Related-Bug: #1348954
Related-Bug: #1367907
Related-Bug: #1382607

commit_message:
Add "Back To Previous Page" link from all Detail pages

While looking at the Instance Details (or any details pages), it
is great to have a quick link to get back to the previous page.
This will give users a quick step back to the full Instances table
view without having to rely on the browser back button.

Change-Id: Id361e7e0470bea70c8805ff5d7b2bb011f3d8984

commit_message:
Add missing indexes in SQLite and PostgreSQL

Some indexes have been created on MySQL databases in past database
migrations but not SQLite or PostgreSQL databases. Complicating the
matter is the fact that MySQL is more lenient with index namespacing
than other databases.

Change-Id: If24b45b722d03168463dfd67d67a39d4fb45f77d
Partially-implements: blueprint validate-migrations-and-model

fixture lets them control the level without worrying about resetting the
value or messing around with underlying implementation.

commit_message:
Rename logging fixture module

Using the name "logging" conflicts with the Python standard library
module of the same name, which causes issues when we try to add another
module in this directory which imports logging. Rename the logging
module to a more descriptive and unique name.

Change-Id: If4017edbc0f8dedba07aa6bdeedc80e0aea3f7c6

commit_message:
Execute unit tests and build DU

- Start from the languagepack provided in the planfile
- Inject user code
- Execute the unit test commands provided in the planfile
- Create a deployment unit with the users code based on the
  languagepack selected by the user.

commit_message:
Introduce run_cmd in the planfile

I'm adding a run commnad to the planfile. This is the application
entry point and should be provided by the application developer.

I've also refactored the way test and run commands are passed to
the unit_test and build scripts. It was getting messy as we add
new variables.

This patch takes the run command from the plan file and passes it
to the build-app script. The command is not being used to start the
application code yet. That will be submitted in a different patch.

Change-Id: I9ef36b8f25a3b4c17fcd9fdec3d0e9e2423bf86f

commit_message:
Make image storage configurable.

- Changed name of image storage config flag from du_storage to image_storage
- Added support for storing languagepack and DU images in
  docker_registry, glance and swift.

Change-Id: Ic0e4ca584fb81341021e6db4b304d742d612d838

subject: Rename NOSTATE to AVAILABLE
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-01-30 13:10:43.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/__init__.py', 'ironic/tests/api/v1/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/tests/db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_pxe.py', 'ironic/common/fsm.py', 'ironic/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/5674c57409b9_replace_nostate_with_available.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/ilo/test_deploy.py', 'ironic/common/states.py', 'ironic/conductor/task_manager.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py', 'ironic/db/api.py'], 'message': 'Rename NOSTATE to AVAILABLE

This patch adds the new provisioning state AVAILABLE, and bumps the API
microversion to 1.1. This version exposes the renaming of the previous
provision_state="None" to provision_state="available" for nodes which
are available for use.

A database migration is added which updates all DB records'
provision_state from NOSTATE to AVAILABLE.

Since database migrations and code changes may be rolled out at
different times, the conductor can deploy to a node in either
NOSTATE or AVAILABLE states.

OperatorImpact:
    This change should be rolled out to production services, and the
    conductor service should be restarted, *before* the database
    migration is applied. Ironic will then begin "translating" existing
    node states to the new AVAILABLE state automatically when it touches
    them. If the DB migration is run much later, it may not actually
    update any records (and that is OK).

DocImpact:
    This change updates the Node provision_state value which represents
    a node that is available for provisioning. It is changed from
    "None" to "available", but this change is only realized when the
    X-OpenStack-Ironic-API-Version header is >= 1.1

*** NOTE ***
Nova interprets the provision_state of Nodes to determine which should
be exposed to the scheduler and counted as available resources. Up to
the Juno release, Nova looked for the "NOSTATE" state to indicate this,
represented as provision_state=None.
After commit Idbd36b230cf997bed7a86c3f56cf9c70995028b2 landed in Nova,
both the old "None" and new "available" states are interpreted in this
way. As such, Nova may continue to use Juno Ironic, which did not
support microversions, or may begin using the 1.1 version.

Implements: blueprint new-ironic-state-machine

Change-Id: I5e6f6ee5877d475136ce2ebad4a9333b424dc96b
'}]
commit_message:
Rename NOSTATE to AVAILABLE

This patch adds the new provisioning state AVAILABLE, and bumps the API
microversion to 1.1. This version exposes the renaming of the previous
provision_state="None" to provision_state="available" for nodes which
are available for use.

A database migration is added which updates all DB records'
provision_state from NOSTATE to AVAILABLE.

Since database migrations and code changes may be rolled out at
different times, the conductor can deploy to a node in either
NOSTATE or AVAILABLE states.

OperatorImpact:
    This change should be rolled out to production services, and the
    conductor service should be restarted, *before* the database
    migration is applied. Ironic will then begin "translating" existing
    node states to the new AVAILABLE state automatically when it touches
    them. If the DB migration is run much later, it may not actually
    update any records (and that is OK).

DocImpact:
    This change updates the Node provision_state value which represents
    a node that is available for provisioning. It is changed from
    "None" to "available", but this change is only realized when the
    X-OpenStack-Ironic-API-Version header is >= 1.1

*** NOTE ***
Nova interprets the provision_state of Nodes to determine which should
be exposed to the scheduler and counted as available resources. Up to
the Juno release, Nova looked for the "NOSTATE" state to indicate this,
represented as provision_state=None.
After commit Idbd36b230cf997bed7a86c3f56cf9c70995028b2 landed in Nova,
both the old "None" and new "available" states are interpreted in this
way. As such, Nova may continue to use Juno Ironic, which did not
support microversions, or may begin using the 1.1 version.

Implements: blueprint new-ironic-state-machine

Change-Id: I5e6f6ee5877d475136ce2ebad4a9333b424dc96b

X-OpenStack-Ironic-API-Version header. This header is also returned
to clients as a hint to improve client response handling.

Additionally, new Minimum-Version and Maximum-Version headers
are also now returned, so as to inform clients of the supported range.

The requested version is stashed in the pecan.request.version object
by a new VersionHook.

For reference as to why this approach was chosen, see the Nova spec on
microversioning:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/approved/api-microversions.html

commit_message:
Add support for API microversions

This patch adds support in the REST API to accept a new
X-OpenStack-Ironic-API-Version header. This header is also returned
to clients as a hint to improve client response handling.

Additionally, new Minimum-Version and Maximum-Version headers
are also now returned, so as to inform clients of the supported range.

The requested version is stashed in the pecan.request.version object
by a new VersionHook.

For reference as to why this approach was chosen, see the Nova spec on
microversioning:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/approved/api-microversions.html

Change-Id: I34bf7fa1b21580337c18206798dd8e9dfe11ba09

commit_message:
libvirt: use image_meta when looking up default device names

In the blockinfo.default_device_names method we must honour the
image_meta properties when looking up the default device names.

Related-bug: #1404196
Change-Id: I8374057a58a97b4377ab1250d2574a2ceb46d8fb

commit_message:
Move default_store option in glance-api.conf

[DEFAULT] default_store was deprecated in Juno and moved into the
[glance_store] section. Yet it remains in the old place in the sample
glance-api.conf. Additionally, some comments still refer to the
known_stores option, which is now simply stores.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7215e35534fd9a77730d39b96f9ba3bf6c3ea065
(cherry picked from commit 99124f627f2d8506a652b8d09740658215ef6674)

commit_message:
Ironic: Check for localboot (PoC)

This is a PoC.

Make the Ironic driver to check for the baremetal:localboot key in the
Flavor and if present updates Ironic to indicate that the instance will
boot from the local disk instead of network (PXE boot).

Change-Id: I90df62f4a73463c911c787194bc274bf97c41780

commit_message:
move oslo.version to attic

oslo.version functionality is no longer needed as it has
been superseded by pbr and other components. None of of
the openstack projects use this library any more.

Change-Id: I2410f90dac701937431c88726369e4c2a8bcc404

commit_message:
Implements the ProcessMonitor in the l3_agent

The ProcessMonitor class will watch over spawned external processes,
taking the administrator configured action in the case of any
of the external processes dying unexpectedly.

It covers both the neutron-ns-metadata-proxy for non-ha routers
and the IPv6 radvd external processes. Keepalived +
neutron-ns-metadata-proxy needs to be covered in a second follow up
patch when neutron-ns-metadata-proxy is handled by the l3-agent
(instead keepalived) in the ha-routers.

Implements: blueprint agent-child-processes-status

Change-Id: Id6cc4786d837b96c61429d51485bc86ae37872cb

commit_message:
Heat stack status column improvement

Status column on stack table is using 'status' instead of 'stack_status'
to keep Horizon from listing all of the various Heat states and from
incorrect displaying progress meters for several of them. However
'stack_status' is more detailed and more useful for user. This patch set
adds 'stack_status' column for detailed status and keeps 'status' column
hidden for correct displaying.

Partially implements blueprint: heat-ui-improvement

Change-Id: Iacf5e9819aaedc508aa19bb2442030c0572e8c1a

commit_message:
Thin MLNX ML2 mechanism driver and agent

This commit thins the in-tree MLNX ML2 MechanismDriver and Agent. A matching
change to the stackforge/networking-mlnx project has the backend logic
there.

Partial-Implements: blueprint core-vendor-decomposition
Closes-Bug: 1414902

Change-Id: I22e6ff37ea289f58ca5a7f49d65f634f72730402

commit_message:
Moves the <service>-api repos to the attic

These repositories contained long-form API documentation
that is replaced with:
API reference information in the openstack/api-site repo
API specification information in the openstack/<project>-specs repos
API user information in openstack-manuals
API specification information for contributor devs in openstack/<project>/doc

Blueprint write up at https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Blueprint-os-api-docs#Goal_4_-_Move_API_Specs_to_project_repositories_and_off_docs_landing_page

Change-Id: Iadab262c1d7a07e5b224db6c018f9d2951c640e8

commit_message:
Fix policy validation in JSONSchema

Fix the JSONSchema for server_group to include the validation of
conflicting policies. The check in the create function in v3 was
removed.

Change-Id: I258f76adb6e5b85838bb2daae0ac25057ea8e650
Closes-Bug: #1413281

commit_message:
Update Horizon to Jasmine 2.1.x

  Update of Jasmine to the newest version, update of angular as well to have
support for it. Remove extra packages (xstatic) from settings files and
improve jasmine error log in the console

Implements: blueprint update-jasmine
Change-Id: I884d0d0708130ff2ea825a3faf83ab929404dec6

The fix 257cf490 introduced a regression by disabling 'Enable'
checkbox in case of editing current project - because Django treats
disabled checkbox as providing the ``False`` value regardless of its
actual value. Fix it by restoring 'Enable' checkbox value in form's
``clean()`` method.

Change-Id: Iaede347b5a8a06a793de2dd62ba8a695f3498ead
Closes-Bug: #1413068
"}]
commit_message:
Fix editing current project

The fix 257cf490 introduced a regression by disabling 'Enable'
checkbox in case of editing current project - because Django treats
disabled checkbox as providing the ``False`` value regardless of its
actual value. Fix it by restoring 'Enable' checkbox value in form's
``clean()`` method.

Change-Id: Iaede347b5a8a06a793de2dd62ba8a695f3498ead
Closes-Bug: #1413068

commit_message:
Adds assert_has_no_errors check

Tests were calling _assert_has_errors(..., expected_errors=None)
which is more easily rendered as _assert_has_no_errors(...)

Change-Id: Iebbbe78ca08346a2e8449ba61e6fdb11be825665

commit_message:
virt: make tests pass instance object to get_instance_disk_info

The hyperv/vmware tests were still passing just an instance
name to the get_instance_disk_info method, after recent
conversion to use full instance. This happened to still work
because both drivers are a no-op for this method.

Change-Id: I80437488b1105889694c2bce11c0f9ac543b7c0d

commit_message:
Update README format for our release script

The release notes script Oslo uses depends on being able to find
information in the README.rst file using a regex, so update the contents
of the file to match that pattern.

Change-Id: Idef33f0438263f7ca4d596b66a36bbe260b53dd4

commit_message:
libvirt: rename conn variable in LibvirtConnTestCase

The local conn variable points to the libvirt Nova driver, not the
libvirt connection. Rename it to self.drvr to stop confusing
everyone.

Blueprint: libvirt-driver-class-refactor
Change-Id: I6713883cc56cf2b1123ec2d9a2733b66c7d5f4be

commit_message:
VLAN support for DVR

Brings in VLAN underlay support for
distributed virtual router. In line with
it brings in the ability to route packets
between VLAN and VXLAN (or) VLAN and GRE
networks via distributed virtual routers.

Implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr-vlan
Closes-Bug: #1374995
Change-Id: If1eb9deef76a49bd0ae0d90ad5ad6a495d97a3b2

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-01-26 11:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'requirements.txt', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py', 'nova/swift.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_swift.py'], 'message': "Ironic: Upload configdrive to Swift

In order to avoid having a binary blob (configdrive) registered in
the Ironic node, this patch is making it configurable to upload the
configdrive to Swift and generate a Temp URL that then can be passed to
Ironic so it can make use of the configdrive.

The swift.py module was put in a common place because it's generic and
could be used by another driver in the future.

Implements: blueprint use-configdrive-with-ironic
Change-Id: I2f983d8c1aa81101eb92e6c25a3a3385b40f1499
"}]
commit_message:
Ironic: Upload configdrive to Swift

In order to avoid having a binary blob (configdrive) registered in
the Ironic node, this patch is making it configurable to upload the
configdrive to Swift and generate a Temp URL that then can be passed to
Ironic so it can make use of the configdrive.

The swift.py module was put in a common place because it's generic and
could be used by another driver in the future.

Implements: blueprint use-configdrive-with-ironic
Change-Id: I2f983d8c1aa81101eb92e6c25a3a3385b40f1499

commit_message:
Add retry decorator allowing to retry DB operations on request

Improve retrying decorator such that wrapped code could request
retry attempt in the arbitrary conditions by raising RetryRequest
exception. Wrapped code should provide inner exception that is
raised when amount of retries are exceeded.

Change-Id: I596fea8dc798a11fcdfdd69208af3313f41d755b

Ironic is beginning to use the node.provision_state of AVAILABLE, rather
than NOSTATE, to represent a node which should be visible to Nova and
available for scheduling workloads onto.

This patch enables the Ironic virt driver to work with an Ironic service
that has migrated to using the new AVAILABLE state, while also remaining
compatible with the previous code.

I5e6f6ee5877d475136ce2ebad4a9333b424dc96b migrates Ironic to use the new
state, and depends on landing this change in Nova first.

For background, see the Ironic spec here:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/kilo/new-ironic-state-machine.html

Change-Id: Idbd36b230cf997bed7a86c3f56cf9c70995028b2
'}]
commit_message:
Begin using ironic's "AVAILABLE" state

Ironic is beginning to use the node.provision_state of AVAILABLE, rather
than NOSTATE, to represent a node which should be visible to Nova and
available for scheduling workloads onto.

This patch enables the Ironic virt driver to work with an Ironic service
that has migrated to using the new AVAILABLE state, while also remaining
compatible with the previous code.

I5e6f6ee5877d475136ce2ebad4a9333b424dc96b migrates Ironic to use the new
state, and depends on landing this change in Nova first.

For background, see the Ironic spec here:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/kilo/new-ironic-state-machine.html

Change-Id: Idbd36b230cf997bed7a86c3f56cf9c70995028b2

Motivation:
The initial driving motivation is to redesign the launch instance

commit_message:
Create a reusable angular based wizard

Motivation:
The initial driving motivation is to redesign the launch instance
wizard based on a modern, responsive design that is based on client
side rendering using angular. Motivation behind creating alternative
implementation is to show slightly different approach to component
design. Main patch set can be found at [1].

Design:
* Alternative, streamlined version of wizard widget.
* Lightweight, highly modular, pluggable design.
* Labels, templates and default data customizable for each step.
* Per-step and overall validation based on ng-form.
* Bootstrap styling.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/137417/

Change-Id: I684f2cbdfe9f6bc20de0af1563fce2772959431b
Implements: blueprint initial-reusable-angular-wizard

commit_message:
stackforge cookbook-ceph is being removed

This cookbook is not being maitained anymore.
There is a https://github.com/ceph/ceph-cookbook to use instead.
Cleanup the cookbook gates to remove the old ceph cookbook.
Move cookbook-ceph to stackforge-attic.

Change-Id: Ib0efc92ef15315cfbf78ee5a0a5d47e1296e91af

commit_message:
Break base service group driver class out from API

Simply breaks the base servicegroup driver out into its own file from
the main servicegroup API file. We want to modify the is_up() SG API
method, and having drivers isolated from the main API file just makes
this cleaner.

Related blueprint: servicegroup-api-is-up-host-topic

Change-Id: I3ac829853c6e667dee82c6b70123487f1f415387

commit_message:
Notification engine refactored from many processes to one

Squished the notification down to one process in preparation for making
multiple engine instances able to talk to the same topic.

Change-Id: Id4799d690c7caf10ae7ba89c2d4e0aeb76c54375

Added HA capabilities to the KafkaConsumer object.

Change-Id: Ie501bd35c225c117c36eb0837763d4abbc46184d

commit_message:
Avoid bdms db call when cleaning deleted instance

There are several actions supported in
_cleanup_running_deleted_instances but only the
'reap' action need bdms access while other actions don't need it.
This patch makes the db hit only when necessary.

Change-Id: I3ff7c8f8c901cebc881c3b419440168f52120b06

commit_message:
Use Python module MyMySQL instead of MySQLdb

There are issues porting to Windows when MySQLdb
C files have to be compiled. New library is
100% Python and 100% compatible.

LAUNCHPAD: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/freezer/+spec/windows-testing

Change-Id: Ic863bd231eaca5a891df61741df5e2ba6433ba4e

commit_message:
Improve policy documentation

The policy documentation was missing a few things that it should be
covering.  These include:

- A description of the policy target.
- How the "rule" check works to reference other defined rules.
- How the "default" rule functionality works.

These items should be documented centrally in oslo.policy so that it
can be referred to by other projects.  This patch adds documentation
for the above items.

Change-Id: Ibd438b0ff256b429e0a53c908e4f5a0ae2032931

commit_message:
Remove quotes to prevent duplicate alarms

The memory alarm has a space in the name. This is causing it to get
surrounded by single quotes, which in turn means grep finds no matches.

This patch removes the quotes to prevent the issue. There may be a more
general issue to address with quotes but it is outside the scope of
this patch.

Change-Id: I5ce02ee8499e593f5813ffe277d3869e7c28d691
Closes-bug: #1416443

commit_message:
Add method for getting the CPU pinning constraint

We add a method that when passed flavor with extra spec containing
hw:cpu_policy key, and an optional NUMA topology instance,
calculates the CPU pinning constraint for the instance (or None if
the instance is not be pinned), and set the cpu_pinning attribute of the
passed NUMA topology (or a constructed one).

In case admin doesn't specify a shared pinning policy on the flavor,
users are free to set it with image metadata 'hw_cpu_policy' key,
otherwise, attempts to override it with the image  key will result in
an error.

This will be done at boot time and then persisted to be used later
in scheduling.

This patch concludes

Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

Change-Id: I17b4eab368fca6ddb7e000f9c24368bbde18534d

Consider CPU pinning request when booting an instance and make sure
that the proper XML is generated. If there was some pinning information
generated as part of the proposed NUMA configuration, this will make
it more specific as it will pin to the exact pCPU core as opposed to

commit_message:
libvirt: Consider CPU pinning when booting

Consider CPU pinning request when booting an instance and make sure
that the proper XML is generated. If there was some pinning information
generated as part of the proposed NUMA configuration, this will make
it more specific as it will pin to the exact pCPU core as opposed to
the set that belongs to a host's NUMA node.

Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
Allow to specify the list of sahara enabled plugins

The list of plugins can be tuned by cloud administrator, so make
sure that the list of checked plugins is not hardcoded.
The default list of plugins matches the one currently enabled.

This commit introduces also a new section for data_processing enabled
features in the tempest configuration.

Change-Id: Ie29aeef2df605cfe840e053bc57ff980e9332636

subject: Fix the standalone authentication mechanism
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 13134, 'name': "Joe D'Andrea", 'email': 'jdandrea@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdandrea'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-30 06:11:51.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/auth_password.py'], 'message': "Fix the standalone authentication mechanism

The keystoneclient used by the password_auth may be a v2 or v3 client.
This means that we shouldn't access arbitrary attributes from the client
as they many not exist on both.

We really don't care about the version of keystoneclient in this case
all we want to do is create a session for getting a token, so copy the
session creation logic out to auth_password.

Change-Id: I1b1f3e3f5822c0bba2dc2e8f592760dd5dba7fbc
Closes-Bug: #1416170
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the standalone authentication mechanism

The keystoneclient used by the password_auth may be a v2 or v3 client.
This means that we shouldn't access arbitrary attributes from the client
as they many not exist on both.

We really don't care about the version of keystoneclient in this case
all we want to do is create a session for getting a token, so copy the
session creation logic out to auth_password.

Change-Id: I1b1f3e3f5822c0bba2dc2e8f592760dd5dba7fbc
Closes-Bug: #1416170

For Kilo, it was decided to split vendor code into stackforge repos, while
services (*aas) code is moved to neutron-*aas repos.
Some components are common to VMWare NSXv neutron plugin and services
plugins.
As we do not want to add dependencies between the neutron-lbaas, neutron-fwaas
repos and the stackforge/vmware-nsx repo, (nor duplicate the code), we move
these common components to oslo.vmware under oslo.vmware.network

Change-Id: If3c98bc9431253768914316db6b48d1777518353
Partially-Implements: blueprint vmware-nsx-v
'}]
commit_message:
VMWare NSXv: Common components

For Kilo, it was decided to split vendor code into stackforge repos, while
services (*aas) code is moved to neutron-*aas repos.
Some components are common to VMWare NSXv neutron plugin and services
plugins.
As we do not want to add dependencies between the neutron-lbaas, neutron-fwaas
repos and the stackforge/vmware-nsx repo, (nor duplicate the code), we move
these common components to oslo.vmware under oslo.vmware.network

Change-Id: If3c98bc9431253768914316db6b48d1777518353
Partially-Implements: blueprint vmware-nsx-v

[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-01-26 21:39:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr.py'], 'message': "Add address family to 'ip rule' calls

Without an address family, 'ip rule' won't work with IPv6
arguments because it assumes IPv4.  This causes the l3-agent
to throw an error when adding a rule in DVR mode.

Also changed these functions to be more symmetrical and take the
same arguments, which required a little tweaking, but it looks
much cleaner now.

Change-Id: I85718d8d6ffcf3dec2a6b92641a731af813114aa
Closes-bug: #1376325
"}]
commit_message:
Add address family to 'ip rule' calls

Without an address family, 'ip rule' won't work with IPv6
arguments because it assumes IPv4.  This causes the l3-agent
to throw an error when adding a rule in DVR mode.

Also changed these functions to be more symmetrical and take the
same arguments, which required a little tweaking, but it looks
much cleaner now.

Change-Id: I85718d8d6ffcf3dec2a6b92641a731af813114aa
Closes-bug: #1376325

We are using the controller to do test instead of
wsgi URI now, the HTTPRequest is only a fake value

Also, some method set such as 'POST', 'DELETE' etc
are not needed anymore since controller are
directly used.

This patch focus on console_auth_tokens, console_output

Change-Id: I359eb78ca0c1dd982e0e63159f6fa66228eaae44

commit_message:
Make test re-use HTTPRequest part 1

We are using the controller to do test instead of
wsgi URI now, the HTTPRequest is only a fake value
and mostly is not used. Make test class reuse
the Request to remove code complication.
Also, some method set such as 'POST', 'DELETE' etc
are not needed anymore since controller are
directly used.

This patch focus on console_auth_tokens, console_output
and keypairs.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I359eb78ca0c1dd982e0e63159f6fa66228eaae44

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 9101, 'name': 'wanghong', 'email': 'reviewwanghong@126.com', 'username': 'wanghong'}, {'_account_id': 13478, 'name': 'Boris Bobrov', 'email': 'b.bobrov@sap.com', 'username': 'bbobrov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-30 15:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/utils.py'], 'message': "Tests use keep_blank_values when parse_qs

The tests weren't using keep_blank_values when calling
urlparse.parse_qs, so any empty values were just ignored and
couldn't be tested properly. With this change, tests can verify
query parameters that have no value (for example, ?no_catalog on
the v3 auth request).

bp auth-token-use-client

Change-Id: Iafcb952c81ca7bd2acab4383687c36ec68a838d2
"}]
commit_message:
Tests use keep_blank_values when parse_qs

The tests weren't using keep_blank_values when calling
urlparse.parse_qs, so any empty values were just ignored and
couldn't be tested properly. With this change, tests can verify
query parameters that have no value (for example, ?no_catalog on
the v3 auth request).

bp auth-token-use-client

Change-Id: Iafcb952c81ca7bd2acab4383687c36ec68a838d2

commit_message:

Rather than bailing out if the current repository is set to a different
branch, always scan from the tag to origin/master to look for unreleased
changes.

The oslo.config libraries are moving away from oslo-namespaced
packages.

Note that his requires oslo.config>=1.6.0

"X-Tenant-Id" and "X-Tenant" auth header is deprecated in
keystonemiddleware [1]. So this remove these header and replace to
"X-Project-Id".
And this also flesh up around RequestContext.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/master/keystonemiddleware/auth_token.py#L371

Change-Id: I5f3adcb6eaed4fe75da6ec77c367a2b6c785ae5d
'}]
commit_message:
Don't use deprecated auth header

"X-Tenant-Id" and "X-Tenant" auth header is deprecated in
keystonemiddleware [1]. So this remove these header and replace to
"X-Project-Id".
And this also flesh up around RequestContext.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/master/keystonemiddleware/auth_token.py#L371

Change-Id: I5f3adcb6eaed4fe75da6ec77c367a2b6c785ae5d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-30 02:19:48.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/common.py'], 'message': 'Add missing exceptions into function docstring

This adds missing exceptions into the following two functions.
Exception handling logic should be fixed in another patch if
necessary.

* ilo.common._prepare_floppy_image()

 :raises: ImageCreationFailed, if it failed while creating the floppy
image.

 It is from images.create_vfat_image()

 :raises: SwiftOperationError, if any operation with Swift fails.

 It is from swift_api.create_object() and swift_api.get_temp_url()

* ilo.common.setup_vmedia_for_boot()

 :raises: SwiftOperationError, if any operation with Swift fails.

 It is from _prepare_floppy_image() and swift_api.get_temp_url().

Change-Id: I78c6c49b76b15c33226b32b2b52002cd5bad4241
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing exceptions into function docstring

This adds missing exceptions into the following two functions.
Exception handling logic should be fixed in another patch if
necessary.

* ilo.common._prepare_floppy_image()

 :raises: ImageCreationFailed, if it failed while creating the floppy
image.

 It is from images.create_vfat_image()

 :raises: SwiftOperationError, if any operation with Swift fails.

 It is from swift_api.create_object() and swift_api.get_temp_url()

* ilo.common.setup_vmedia_for_boot()

 :raises: SwiftOperationError, if any operation with Swift fails.

 It is from _prepare_floppy_image() and swift_api.get_temp_url().

Change-Id: I78c6c49b76b15c33226b32b2b52002cd5bad4241

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-30 01:20:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': "Don't do snapshot when other action in progress

According to the referenced bug report, snapshot and restore operations
are not checking the stack status. The result is that some duplicate or
orphan VMs left. This patch adds a check in snapshot operation that will
reject a snapshot request when it seems unsafe.

partial-bug: 1412952
Change-Id: I5b5da312ac08fd5f15418dd6cf9670463180d7ad
"}]
commit_message:
Don't do snapshot when other action in progress

According to the referenced bug report, snapshot and restore operations
are not checking the stack status. The result is that some duplicate or
orphan VMs left. This patch adds a check in snapshot operation that will
reject a snapshot request when it seems unsafe.

partial-bug: 1412952
Change-Id: I5b5da312ac08fd5f15418dd6cf9670463180d7ad

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-28 21:53:45.000000000', 'files': ['README.md'], 'message': 'readme clarifications for new developers using redstack

There are 3 areas in the README.md that could benefit from
clarification for new developers:

1. change the recommended development environment from Ubuntu 12.04
(precise) to 14.04 (trusty). Seems like this is the current viable
environment in use by developers.
2. expanded details of navigating the multiple screens set up by
redstack
3. clarify that kick-start is necessary for a usable default
test.conf file (in the absence of a developer override of
TROVE_CONF_DIR) i.e.,
cmd_build_and_upload_image->cmd_set_datastore

Closes-Bug: #1409038
Change-Id: I129e9f24aca7ad401724b6c3bdb8408879eb026c
'}]
commit_message:
readme clarifications for new developers using redstack

There are 3 areas in the README.md that could benefit from
clarification for new developers:

1. change the recommended development environment from Ubuntu 12.04
(precise) to 14.04 (trusty). Seems like this is the current viable
environment in use by developers.
2. expanded details of navigating the multiple screens set up by
redstack
3. clarify that kick-start is necessary for a usable default
test.conf file (in the absence of a developer override of
TROVE_CONF_DIR) i.e.,
cmd_build_and_upload_image->cmd_set_datastore

Closes-Bug: #1409038
Change-Id: I129e9f24aca7ad401724b6c3bdb8408879eb026c

Add networking-cisco to stackforge

This repo will be used for the development of the Cisco Vendor specific
code for Neutron.

This repo is required to remain inline with the Neutron vendor code
decomposition [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/134680/

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-30 11:55:28.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/oslo_messaging.yml'], 'message': 'Pinned Oslo Messaging version to version 1.4.1

This change pins oslo messaging to version 1.4.1 which will satisfy
both icehouse and juno requirements. This change was in direct
response a support request.

The issue with the latest Oslo Messaging for Juno, Oslo 1.5.1,
is that there is a potential for it to open too many connections
to rabbitmq. While this behavior is present in version 1.4.1 as well
it is less so than in 1.5.1. At this time pinning the version will
create a better overall deployment experience.

Change-Id: I37793557d53fc5965547d2b8cc3ca44812def8db
Partial-Bug: 1406629
(cherry picked from commit 227c1029f7febb3527e0729b84bb03a8c9d2d631)
'}]
commit_message:
Pinned Oslo Messaging version to version 1.4.1

This change pins oslo messaging to version 1.4.1 which will satisfy
both icehouse and juno requirements. This change was in direct
response a support request.

The issue with the latest Oslo Messaging for Juno, Oslo 1.5.1,
is that there is a potential for it to open too many connections
to rabbitmq. While this behavior is present in version 1.4.1 as well
it is less so than in 1.5.1. At this time pinning the version will
create a better overall deployment experience.

Change-Id: I37793557d53fc5965547d2b8cc3ca44812def8db
Partial-Bug: 1406629
(cherry picked from commit 227c1029f7febb3527e0729b84bb03a8c9d2d631)

VmWare vCenter settings are currently available on Settings Tab
and are only available before the deploy is done. It is very
desirable to have the settings available after deploy.
It is also required to support multiple vCenters for
Compute service. The settings will be always available in
VmWare tab of Cluster page, the functionality will be moved

Implements: blueprint vmware-ui-settings
'}]
commit_message:
VmWare UI Settings Tab for FuelWeb

VmWare vCenter settings are currently available on Settings Tab
and are only available before the deploy is done. It is very
desirable to have the settings available after deploy.
It is also required to support multiple vCenters for
Compute service. The settings will be always available in
VmWare tab of Cluster page, the functionality will be moved
to a plugin when plugins are available.

Change-Id: Ic8d47d2cc82e5710bd0431b506de93ea8f1884fb
Implements: blueprint vmware-ui-settings

The core thing is next:

commit_message:
Add plugin base

We have various kinds of plugins. For now they are next:

1) Benchmark Engines
2) Server Provides
3) Scenarios
4) Scenario Runners
5) Context
6) SLA
And maybe in future other stuff....

The core thing is next:
1) All type of plugins have configuration
2) All plugins should be accessable via unique name
3) All plugins should have ability to validate their configuration
4) All plugins should be deprecateble in the same way

So it really makes sense to create single base that adds
abbility to do all this stuff

Change-Id: Ic11b299e0ce09b72718f5bb5504fd56218397fe1

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-12-20 13:13:23.000000000', 'files': ['USECASES.md', 'spec/system/ceph_usecases_spec.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Rewrite the usecases to actually working scenarios

Only one of the usecases was clearly marked as not working in this form,
while in reality all but the first do not work.
This could have led to confusion for prospective users of the module or
worse turn them away from using the module.

As the current puppet recipes are proven via CI to actually support these
usecases on Ubuntu Precise and RedHat 6.4 family, instead of adding a
header about them not being expected to work, they were instead adapted
to working examples (with minor adaptions to user specific setups as a
caveat).

Change-Id: Id30d339ef1295bb50dcf017eefc996edfc8dbe60
Closes-Bug: #1327785
'}]
commit_message:
Rewrite the usecases to actually working scenarios

Only one of the usecases was clearly marked as not working in this form,
while in reality all but the first do not work.
This could have led to confusion for prospective users of the module or
worse turn them away from using the module.

As the current puppet recipes are proven via CI to actually support these
usecases on Ubuntu Precise and RedHat 6.4 family, instead of adding a
header about them not being expected to work, they were instead adapted
to working examples (with minor adaptions to user specific setups as a
caveat).

Change-Id: Id30d339ef1295bb50dcf017eefc996edfc8dbe60
Closes-Bug: #1327785

commit_message:
Use oslo_middleware instead of deprecated oslo.middleware

oslo.middleware 0.3.0 has changed its namespace from oslo.middleware to
oslo_middleware, the old import style of oslo.middlewere still can work but
it is deprecated.

The issue with the latest Oslo Messaging for Juno, Oslo 1.5.1,
is that there is a potential for it to open too many connections

commit_message:
Pinned Oslo Messaging version to version 1.4.1

This change pins oslo messaging to version 1.4.1 which will satisfy
both icehouse and juno requirements. This change was in direct
response a support request.

The issue with the latest Oslo Messaging for Juno, Oslo 1.5.1,
is that there is a potential for it to open too many connections
to rabbitmq. While this behavior is present in version 1.4.1 as well
it is less so than in 1.5.1. At this time pinning the version will
create a better overall deployment experience.

Change-Id: I37793557d53fc5965547d2b8cc3ca44812def8db
Partial-Bug: 1406629
(cherry picked from commit 227c1029f7febb3527e0729b84bb03a8c9d2d631)

commit_message:
Refactor iptables rule expansion for the non ipset case

IptablesFirewallDriver / _select_sg_rules_for_port was
handling the rule expansion for the non ipset case all
inside the same function.

This patch refactors the expansion out, so it will be
more clear, and easier to cut out non-ipset code later
in time.

Partially implements blueprint refactor-iptables-firewall-driver

Change-Id: I4225d233e59da797e9fa1737757d039eb946cba1

If a network subnet runs out of IP addresses while creating a port

is no where handled in nova. This patch will handle the exception to

commit_message:
Fix error message when no IP addresses available.

If a network subnet runs out of IP addresses while creating a port
for the VM, neutron will throw NoMoreFixedIps exception, this exception
is no where handled in nova. This patch will handle the exception to
show the proper error message.

Closes-Bug: 1394268
Change-Id: I85343706f926ceaec15a964eceeb44669f993a4e

commit_message:
Enabling and fixing the rspec tests for profiles

Because Puppet 2.7 has been deprecated the rspec tests for the
profile classes which require hiera autolookup can now be enabled.

At the same time they became out of sync because they weren't run
and are now updated to work with the current code again.

Change-Id: I8b62e111871f999c8535880cc17627878c53f35e

commit_message:
Tempest changes

This change does the following:

* updates neutron ansible library to support adding networks, subnets,
  routers, etc.
* updates tempest_resources to create network/subnet/router,
  tempest-specific flavors, and swift reseller role
* updates tempest.conf to disable neutron features which don't work in
  our environment and other minor changes
* updates tempest.conf to enable swift tests depending on whether
  tempest_swift_enabled is set (we also create
  inventory/group_vars/tempest_all.yml defaulting this to true)

  shouldn't be unsafe.
- when adding tests for extra repositories curl was removed as a workaround,
  that's not a valid operation under centos, as yum depends on it.
- the recently applied fix for SNT didn't work under centos yet, due to
  additional whitespace.

Change-Id: I583ceb38cec72ae908dbdd5e6d937ed09058f446

commit_message:
This fixes various issues with the centos CI tests

As the centos CI tests haven't been run for a while various issues
have accumulated:

- due to POODLE, downloading the EPEL mirror list doesn't work over https
  anymore. Switched to http. As packages are still verified via GPG, this
  shouldn't be unsafe.
- when adding tests for extra repositories curl was removed as a workaround,
  that's not a valid operation under centos, as yum depends on it.
- the recently applied fix for SNT didn't work under centos yet, due to
  additional whitespace.

Change-Id: I583ceb38cec72ae908dbdd5e6d937ed09058f446

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6783, 'name': 'Nathan Reller', 'email': 'nathan.s.reller@gmail.com', 'username': 'rellerreller'}, {'_account_id': 7136, 'name': 'Chad Lung', 'email': 'chad.lung@gmail.com', 'username': 'chadlung'}, {'_account_id': 7262, 'name': 'John Vrbanac', 'email': 'john.vrbanac@linux.com', 'username': 'john.vrbanac'}, {'_account_id': 7354, 'name': 'Jarret Raim', 'email': 'jarret.raim@rackspace.com', 'username': 'jraim'}, {'_account_id': 7355, 'name': 'Steven Gonzales', 'email': 'stevendgonzales@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevendgonzales'}, {'_account_id': 7687, 'name': 'Donald Stufft', 'email': 'donald@stufft.io', 'username': 'dstufft'}, {'_account_id': 7789, 'name': 'John Wood', 'email': 'john.wood@rackspace.com', 'username': 'woodster'}, {'_account_id': 7973, 'name': 'Douglas Mendizábal', 'email': 'dmendiza@redhat.com', 'username': 'dougmendizabal'}, {'_account_id': 8004, 'name': 'Paul Kehrer', 'email': 'paul.l.kehrer@gmail.com', 'username': 'reaperhulk'}, {'_account_id': 9234, 'name': 'Steve Heyman', 'email': 'steve@heyman.com', 'username': 'hockeynut'}, {'_account_id': 9914, 'name': 'Ade Lee', 'email': 'alee@redhat.com', 'username': 'alee'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-28 12:23:04.000000000', 'files': ['bin/barbican-db-manage.py'], 'message': 'Handle SystemExit properly in migration script

The migration script was catching all exceptions and using
log.exception in case there was any. The problem is, argparse raises a
SystemExit exception after printing the "help" with an exit code of 0.
This would eventually get caught as an exception. Being this an
exception, the logging would print the stack trace, which in the case
of a proper exit would be very confusing, as one might think there is
a problem, when there isn't.

This change now omits the logging if there as a system exit with a 0
or None code (Which is the default code if you call "sys.exit()").

Also, some pep8 issues were fixed here.

Change-Id: I300358e28b39a8a65d7b4253dcca975b46bf757c
'}]
commit_message:
Handle SystemExit properly in migration script

The migration script was catching all exceptions and using
log.exception in case there was any. The problem is, argparse raises a
SystemExit exception after printing the "help" with an exit code of 0.
This would eventually get caught as an exception. Being this an
exception, the logging would print the stack trace, which in the case
of a proper exit would be very confusing, as one might think there is
a problem, when there isn't.

This change now omits the logging if there as a system exit with a 0
or None code (Which is the default code if you call "sys.exit()").

Also, some pep8 issues were fixed here.

Change-Id: I300358e28b39a8a65d7b4253dcca975b46bf757c

do its work.
2. Run time synchronization in debug mode ('-d').
3. Sync time on master node using ntpdate instead of
ntpd (remove debug key '-d', add '-v' - be verbose)
4. Print 'stdout' and 'exit_code' in addition to
'stderr' if remote command returned non-zero code.

Change-Id: I8c7a8dbc8f71591f7fedfc7b280014cc4887bf66

commit_message:
Improve time sync and its logging in system tests

1. Don't kill ntp process, let daemon init script
do its work.
2. Run time synchronization in debug mode ('-d').
3. Sync time on master node using ntpdate instead of
ntpd (remove debug key '-d', add '-v' - be verbose)
4. Print 'stdout' and 'exit_code' in addition to
'stderr' if remote command returned non-zero code.

Closes-bug: #1415596

Change-Id: I8c7a8dbc8f71591f7fedfc7b280014cc4887bf66

commit_message:
Manager driver parameters support

Common manager does not allow to create it's driver with arguments
while arguments required for example for dogpile backends.

This patch adds the capability to pass needed parameters to underlying driver
upon initialization.

bp redis-storage-backend

Change-Id: Ib92710e24f372df7ecd3b45f67cdbccf06a9a06e

commit_message:
Fix sequential tasks publishing the same variable

Fixes a bug where a second task cannot update a published variable.
Modifies the merge_dicts utility to have an overwrite flag. Modifies the
evaluate_task_outbound_context method to allow overwrite when merging
dicts.

Closes bug: 1415668

Change-Id: I579f932d422228233ad2d22f21999b48a9b92b9f

commit_message:
Pinned Oslo Messaging version to version 1.4.1

This change pins oslo messaging to version 1.4.1 which will satisfy
both icehouse and juno requirements. This change was in direct
response a support request.

The issue with the latest Oslo Messaging for Juno, Oslo 1.5.1,
is that there is a potential for it to open too many connections
to rabbitmq. While this behavior is present in version 1.4.1 as well
it is less so than in 1.5.1. At this time pinning the version will
create a better overall deployment experience.

Change-Id: I37793557d53fc5965547d2b8cc3ca44812def8db
Partial-Bug: 1406629

The volume migration code checks if a volume is active or in-use.
If in either of these states it cannot be migrated and errors out.
The error message for this currently incorrectly states that it

commit_message:
Fix incorrect and misleading error message for volume migration

The volume migration code checks if a volume is active or in-use.
If in either of these states it cannot be migrated and errors out.
The error message for this currently incorrectly states that it
must be in one of these states. This patch negates that statement.

Change-Id: I9becedd9151e5e2f03f252d343936ee7de79c61a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-30 04:25:21.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/host_common/tasks/main.yml', 'rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': "Adds basic host kernel optimisation

This change adds three values to basic kernel optimisation which
should result in a more stable system.

Values that will be added in:
  - { key: 'vm.dirty_background_ratio', value: 5 }
  - { key: 'vm.dirty_ratio', value: 10 }
  - { key: 'vm.swappiness', value: 5 }

These values should improve general system operation and performance
when hosts have a potential for high IO. This is especially true in
a containerized environment when there are more than 20+ containers
running on a single host all potentially using LVM as the backend.

Change-Id: Ie4bf8d4d7e1b77c12bb3abec1b2d75c47ed29895
Closes-Bug: 1409755
"}]
commit_message:
Adds basic host kernel optimisation

This change adds three values to basic kernel optimisation which
should result in a more stable system.

Values that will be added in:
  - { key: 'vm.dirty_background_ratio', value: 5 }
  - { key: 'vm.dirty_ratio', value: 10 }
  - { key: 'vm.swappiness', value: 5 }

These values should improve general system operation and performance
when hosts have a potential for high IO. This is especially true in
a containerized environment when there are more than 20+ containers
running on a single host all potentially using LVM as the backend.

Change-Id: Ie4bf8d4d7e1b77c12bb3abec1b2d75c47ed29895
Closes-Bug: 1409755

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-28 21:13:41.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/f5-config.py'], 'message': "Fix inventory_group TypeErrors

When generating the F5 script, the inventory_group variable will be None
at the end of recursion. This fix adds another base case to ensure that
the function doesn't raise an exception.

Change-Id: I39394b4c0906943c6b014665af944e6dcaa6a50b
Closes-Bug: #1413703
(cherry picked from commit c6b942de19502f7aceec26bdf2c191d3a7483edb)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix inventory_group TypeErrors

When generating the F5 script, the inventory_group variable will be None
at the end of recursion. This fix adds another base case to ensure that
the function doesn't raise an exception.

Change-Id: I39394b4c0906943c6b014665af944e6dcaa6a50b
Closes-Bug: #1413703
(cherry picked from commit c6b942de19502f7aceec26bdf2c191d3a7483edb)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-04 15:07:10.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/rabbitmq/templates/rabbitmq-server_ubuntu.erb'], 'message': "Prepend erb variables with '@' in rabbitmq initscript.

Accessing variables in templates without '@' prefix is deprecated
and results in Puppet emitting a warning.

Change-Id: Ibb2a04b2f1240ae206fcb5bd3da608c64b636ae4
Partial-Bug: 1390099

commit_message:
Prepend erb variables with '@' in rabbitmq initscript.

Accessing variables in templates without '@' prefix is deprecated
and results in Puppet emitting a warning.

Change-Id: Ibb2a04b2f1240ae206fcb5bd3da608c64b636ae4
Partial-Bug: 1390099

commit_message:
Add --remove option for fuel plugins

This option deletes the plugin that was previously installed.
Optionally ==<version> can be specified as in:

fuel plugins --remove fuel_plugin_example==1.0.0

DocImpact
related to blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

Change-Id: I8d8ac913c74710843c4a617fac214625af7eda1e

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-30 09:53:38.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/tests/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix CLI calls without auth in tests

Because Client.auth_required is a property, when mocking it
mock.PropertyMock must be used.
This bug was invisible because of mocking requests library
in all places where fixed mock was used and call to verison API
was also mocked. This call was returning malformed body so it was
treated as auth is not required.

Change-Id: I634e56bbbc38f59dbea29e39536403480c90f013

commit_message:
Fix CLI calls without auth in tests

Because Client.auth_required is a property, when mocking it
mock.PropertyMock must be used.
This bug was invisible because of mocking requests library
in all places where fixed mock was used and call to verison API
was also mocked. This call was returning malformed body so it was
treated as auth is not required.

Change-Id: I634e56bbbc38f59dbea29e39536403480c90f013

commit_message:
Fix typos in commit I68c9f9f86f5f113bb111c0f4fd83216ae0659d36

This patch addresses the comments on the final revision of patch 150187

Also pointed out was the fact that a minor behaviour change was
not noted in the commit message of the base patch:
verify_iscsi_connection can raise exception.InstanceDeployFailure
should the function timeout.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-27 08:48:35.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient_federation/auth/v3/__init__.py', 'keystoneclient_federation/auth/v3/saml2.py', 'keystoneclient_federation/auth/v3/federation.py'], 'message': 'Create a framework for federation plugins

Create a standard base class for federation plugins. This base class has
one abstract method which fetches an unscoped token by the federation
specific method.

The base class is then responsible for handling transitioning from that
unscoped token to a scoped one if any scoping information is provided.

Co-Authored-By: Jamie Lennox <jamielennox@redhat.com>
Implements bp add-saml2-cli-authentication

Change-Id: I7bcaae6eb232dbd27ac67ebb56f43c652476f4db
'}]
commit_message:
Create a framework for federation plugins

Create a standard base class for federation plugins. This base class has
one abstract method which fetches an unscoped token by the federation
specific method.

The base class is then responsible for handling transitioning from that
unscoped token to a scoped one if any scoping information is provided.

Co-Authored-By: Jamie Lennox <jamielennox@redhat.com>
Implements bp add-saml2-cli-authentication

Change-Id: I7bcaae6eb232dbd27ac67ebb56f43c652476f4db

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-28 14:24:13.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/objects/environment.py', 'fuelclient/cli/actions/node.py', 'fuelclient/tests/test_nodes_execute_tasks.py', 'fuelclient/client.py', 'fuelclient/cli/arguments.py', 'fuelclient/tests/test_environment.py'], 'message': 'Commands to execute only part of graph

Added several flags to execute particular tasks

Examples of commands below:

Next command will execute only tasks specified in tasks parameter
  fuel node --node 2 --tasks hiera netconfig

Command with skip, will requests all tasks and remove tasks in skip
parameter
  fuel node --node 2 --skip hiera netconfig

Command with end flag, will requests all tasks up to the end node in graph
and execute them
  fuel node --node 2 --end hiera

Also end can be combined with skip, and then part of graph will be fetched and
part of graph removed
  fuel node --node 2 --end netconfig --skip hiera netconfig

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I48340bdabe8c1aabc2e47b1a2e153618742981d2
'}]
commit_message:
Commands to execute only part of graph

Added several flags to execute particular tasks

Examples of commands below:

Next command will execute only tasks specified in tasks parameter
  fuel node --node 2 --tasks hiera netconfig

Command with skip, will requests all tasks and remove tasks in skip
parameter
  fuel node --node 2 --skip hiera netconfig

Command with end flag, will requests all tasks up to the end node in graph
and execute them
  fuel node --node 2 --end hiera

Also end can be combined with skip, and then part of graph will be fetched and
part of graph removed
  fuel node --node 2 --end netconfig --skip hiera netconfig

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I48340bdabe8c1aabc2e47b1a2e153618742981d2

commit_message:
Fix authtoken configuration in swift proxy-sever.conf

This patch fill auth_host and admin_password in the authtoken
section. Whitout that patch swift cannot verify user tokens and
a simple "swift stat" command returns "Account not found".

Change-Id: I7cf2f119c23519db4989330586b4732d2a9ee0f7
Related-Bug: #1415242

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-20 10:46:24.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/rabbitmq/manifests/install/rabbitmqadmin.pp'], 'message': 'Add retries for rabbitmqadmin curl command

W/o this patch, Rabbitmq::Install::Rabbitmqadmin
sometimes fails to install the rabbitmqadmin script if
there are some connectivity (which is non-transient) errors.

The solution is to add retries for exec command as curl allows
retries only for transient errors and fails for connectivity
errors.

commit_message:
Add retries for rabbitmqadmin curl command

W/o this patch, Rabbitmq::Install::Rabbitmqadmin
sometimes fails to install the rabbitmqadmin script if
there are some connectivity (which is non-transient) errors.

The solution is to add retries for exec command as curl allows
retries only for transient errors and fails for connectivity
errors.

Closes-bug: #1412712
Related-bug: #1410119

Change-Id: I681599ea4a2756e7a442c194c68cf0a484f24f7f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-01-29 14:59:23.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/tests/api/v1/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_rpcapi.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py', 'ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'Add logic to store the config drive passed by Nova

This patch is extending the /nodes/<uuid>/provision API endpoint to accept
an optional "configdrive" parameter as part of the request BODY. If
present, Ironic will get the config drive and store it either directly
on the Node's instance_info field or it will upload it to Swift first,
generates a temp URL and then store it on Node's instance_info to be
processed later after the deployment started.

Two new config options were added to the conductor:

* configdrive_use_swift: Whether to upload the config drive to Swift ot
  not. Defaults to False

* configdrive_swift_container: The name of the container in Swift to
  store the config drive. Defaults to ironic_configdrive_container

Implements: blueprint expose-configdrive
Change-Id: Icc39af604af6439e85f14d1beb2c19b10e983635
'}]
commit_message:
Add logic to store the config drive passed by Nova

This patch is extending the /nodes/<uuid>/provision API endpoint to accept
an optional "configdrive" parameter as part of the request BODY. If
present, Ironic will get the config drive and store it either directly
on the Node's instance_info field or it will upload it to Swift first,
generates a temp URL and then store it on Node's instance_info to be
processed later after the deployment started.

Two new config options were added to the conductor:

* configdrive_use_swift: Whether to upload the config drive to Swift ot
  not. Defaults to False

* configdrive_swift_container: The name of the container in Swift to
  store the config drive. Defaults to ironic_configdrive_container

Implements: blueprint expose-configdrive
Change-Id: Icc39af604af6439e85f14d1beb2c19b10e983635

commit_message:
update metric names in maas_local playbook

PR https://github.com/rcbops/rpc-maas/pull/145/files

changed the names of some of the metrics that the plugins produce.  We
need to update the names of the metrics in our playbooks to ensure we're
creating alarms against the new names

Change-Id: Ibe5e6159dfb3897a8c3bba057b00243d607bd23e
Closes-Bug: 1415542

subject: Set the binlog expire option in Galera
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7307, 'name': 'Matt Thompson', 'email': 'mattt@defunct.ca', 'username': 'mattt416'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-29 11:44:11.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/galera_config/templates/my.cnf'], 'message': 'Set the binlog expire option in Galera

This option was left unset which can cause the bin log to grow forever.
Because we generally run in containers backed by LVM and the space which
the container is allowed to grow is limited. With that in mind we need to
to do everything possible to ensure that we do not create situations
that result in 100% full FS. This change sets the ``expire-logs-days``
to "7" which should be enough to provide for the optional bin log along
while also keeping the FS tidy.

Change-Id: I2c89d85ec77122a54419bdb2d5790e2a6e49fed8
Closes-bug: 1402487
(cherry picked from commit 9ed2f64224cba1f68341529db26c15cf8c91562a)
'}]
commit_message:
Set the binlog expire option in Galera

This option was left unset which can cause the bin log to grow forever.
Because we generally run in containers backed by LVM and the space which
the container is allowed to grow is limited. With that in mind we need to
to do everything possible to ensure that we do not create situations
that result in 100% full FS. This change sets the ``expire-logs-days``
to "7" which should be enough to provide for the optional bin log along
while also keeping the FS tidy.

Change-Id: I2c89d85ec77122a54419bdb2d5790e2a6e49fed8
Closes-bug: 1402487
(cherry picked from commit 9ed2f64224cba1f68341529db26c15cf8c91562a)

commit_message:
object of type 'Agent' has no len()

In dhcp_agent_scheduler.py the dhcp_agents and agents are Agent type.
But we are getting length from them which will cause a TypeError.

Change-Id: I7b8f5700c9ff2835488d72c9751a511775274156

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-01-29 15:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/rabbit_common/tasks/main.yml', 'rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/rabbit.yml', 'rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/rabbitmq.yml'], 'message': 'Pin rabbitmq package version

This patch implements a pinned RabbitMQ package version which is
downloaded (by default) from the official RabbitMQ package download
location.

The user has the ability to use the following variables in order to
override where the package downloads from and what version is
downloaded:
 - rabbitmq_version: the package version
 - rabbitmq_repo_url: the base url to download from
 - rabbitmq_package_url: the full url including the base, the path and
   the package file name

Partial-Bug: #1412898
Change-Id: I206daf4df18aa90d975f979a656de60a06e7c8f3
'}]
commit_message:
Pin rabbitmq package version

This patch implements a pinned RabbitMQ package version which is
downloaded (by default) from the official RabbitMQ package download
location.

The user has the ability to use the following variables in order to
override where the package downloads from and what version is
downloaded:
 - rabbitmq_version: the package version
 - rabbitmq_repo_url: the base url to download from
 - rabbitmq_package_url: the full url including the base, the path and
   the package file name

Partial-Bug: #1412898
Change-Id: I206daf4df18aa90d975f979a656de60a06e7c8f3

commit_message:
do parameter check before updating endpoint_group

Currently, the update method of endpoint_group does parameter check
after updating endpoint_group. This leads to a bug that invalid data
will be updated successfully although api returns 400.

Change-Id: I94c0034a7bed2fe5b6f183ae8ef8d82cba512344
Closes-Bug: #1408930

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7307, 'name': 'Matt Thompson', 'email': 'mattt@defunct.ca', 'username': 'mattt416'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-01-29 23:03:28.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/glance.yml', 'rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/heat.yml', 'rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/horizon.yml', 'rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/nova.yml', 'rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/cinder.yml', 'rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/keystone.yml', 'rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/neutron.yml'], 'message': 'Bump OpenStack versions to 2014.2.1

We are currently hitting a neutron bug
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1397796) which is preventing a
neutron-db-manage from completing when running git_install_branch
2014.2.  This change bumps OpenStack versions to 2014.2.1 where the
issue is resolved.  We also bump rpc_release to 10.1.2rc1 to point to a
wheel repo which has necessary wheels for bump to 2014.2.1.

Closes-Bug: #1412597
Change-Id: If0285847dc7361b66f86ff77b705a6a415f58915
'}]
commit_message:
Bump OpenStack versions to 2014.2.1

We are currently hitting a neutron bug
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1397796) which is preventing a
neutron-db-manage from completing when running git_install_branch
2014.2.  This change bumps OpenStack versions to 2014.2.1 where the
issue is resolved.  We also bump rpc_release to 10.1.2rc1 to point to a
wheel repo which has necessary wheels for bump to 2014.2.1.

Closes-Bug: #1412597
Change-Id: If0285847dc7361b66f86ff77b705a6a415f58915

Add validate token for v2.0

There was no API to validate a token using v2.0.

bp auth-token-use-client

commit_message:
Add 'irmc_' prefix to optional properties

The optional driver_info properties are missing the 'irmc_'
prefix from their names. This patch adds them. The
descriptions were modified a bit so that 'Optional' is at the
end (easier for the reader to see/distinguish between Required
and Optional).

This is a follow-on patch to https://review.openstack.org/144901.
Implements: blueprint irmc-power-driver

Change-Id: I640ae0b4ec022b9cda6dd3f5194d4f2da4dc5935
